availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hugh Henry (Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier - 4th Ky. Mtd. Inf.)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of David Henry and Amanda Henry. Resident of Bourbon County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a 1st Lieutenant, 2nd Lieutenant, and Captain from August 21, 1861 to February 12, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 296B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern District, p. 662.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Flat Rock, p. 297B.
“Henry, Hugh,” Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers Who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0099.
"Hugh Henry (1841-1919)," Find A Grave, Memorial 15730931, accessed January 17, 2024, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/15730931.
